abstract: Shares of Primerica, which Citigroup spun off, leaped as much as 30 percent above their initial public offering price on Thursday, on optimism that the life insurer is poised to benefit from a rebounding economy.
snippet: Shares of Primerica, which Citigroup spun off, leaped as much as 30 percent above their initial public offering price on Thursday, on optimism that the life insurer is poised to benefit from a rebounding economy.
lead_paragraph: Shares of Primerica, which Citigroup spun off, leaped as much as 30 percent above their initial public offering price on Thursday, on optimism that the life insurer is poised to benefit from a rebounding economy, Reuters reports. The shares opened at $19.15 and rose as high as $19.94 on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday afternoon.

headline.main: Primerica Climbs in First Day of Trading
